content: Please feel free to ask general questions regarding dev days in this topic.
..please add me to the 'private' speakers channel. Thanks.

Hello! I'm not clear on how to access devdays sessions. I did download Whova from Google Play and tried to join the Devdays event but looks I need an invitation code to access it. I did hit "Request access", but haven't received any emails. Is there a way to access the sessions through a windows machine, I'd prefer to use my laptop to listen in.
Thanks and looking forward to next week! Priya
Hello Priya. To access the app via your desktop, please follow this link: https://whova.com/portal/webapp/keyco_202001/
you will need to use your email address that you registered with to access the sessions.
@Linda Jenkins Thank you Mary Ann! I was looking for the desktop link.
Thanks Mary Ann! That worked!
Will we have access to the sessions later since they are recorded?
yes, if the speaker consented to sharing, everything will be posted online within 24 hours
I am wondering if the Tuesday 12:45 to 1:25 session titled "Deep Dive on ONC Final Rule’s Information Blocking Provisions" was recorded and if it will become available through the webapp?
I imagine it would. @Marita Mantle-Kloosterboer would you happen to know about this one?
Will check on the recordings - the PDF of the slides will be uploaded this afternoon.

Hello, another questions to the recording. Based on the chat not every session will be recorded and published afterwards in the app. Is there a list of every sessing which will be/ will not be recorded to plan the shedule?
The Let's Build, meet&greet and FHIR Side Chats will not be recorded. Rest will be. (all tutorials and community track).

A "technical question": When watching presentations in Chrome via the Whova web-app, I cannot see the list of questions updated unless I do refresh the page. That is kind of annoying. How can I work around that or can you fix it?
I was trying to watch this old video, but there seems to be something wrong with the video: https://www.devdays.com/videos/implementing-careplan-templates/#prettyPhoto

Marco Wedekind said:

A "technical question": When watching presentations in Chrome via the Whova web-app, I cannot see the list of questions updated unless I do refresh the page. That is kind of annoying. How can I work around that or can you fix it?

That is unfortunately the case with the Whova at this stage. It sometimes helps if you toggle between the chat and Q&A, but indeed, it does not refresh automatically. It has been raised to Whova.

Håkan MacLean said:

I was trying to watch this old video, but there seems to be something wrong with the video: https://www.devdays.com/videos/implementing-careplan-templates/#prettyPhoto

Something is surely wrong there indeed! @Ardon Toonstra Could you have a look at that?
Thnx for the heads-up. The link should be working again! @Håkan MacLean

Is it ok to share the recorded talks with colleagues? E.g. https://us02web.zoom.us/rec/play/-5xbD-KDk2dCfl1MrhHaqOtyAnz3O2xy82RffTxPPrSuUFEumMzx4yJW-B9KSvBIQGGHUscIaBuSrD5f.4DJ5c7zQN426NHcj?continueMode=true&_x_zm_rtaid=0ZtFMbMJSyW2Y_-b4PPHPQ.1605791943589.2be2796fc02593005fb4fc2c03b727c9&_x_zm_rhtaid=199
@Håkan MacLean The intention is that the talks and slides are 6 months exclusively accessible to the attendees of the conference. After that they will be made public.

Marita Mantle-Kloosterboer said:

The Let's Build, meet&greet and FHIR Side Chats will not be recorded. Rest will be. (all tutorials and community track).

Hello, I just realized that the Lets Build sessions are not recorded. I think I have missed all of these and this is something I was looking forward to towards the end via recorded sessions. Can someone please advise/ share about what was discussed in each of the LetsBuild FHIR app, especially the Java track (for all days)

Calvin said:

Marita Mantle-Kloosterboer said:

The Let's Build, meet&greet and FHIR Side Chats will not be recorded. Rest will be. (all tutorials and community track).

Hello, I just realized that the Lets Build sessions are not recorded. I think I have missed all of these and this is something I was looking forward to towards the end via recorded sessions. Can someone please advise/ share about what was discussed in each of the LetsBuild FHIR app, especially the Java track (for all days)

@Mirjam Baltus Can you inform Calvin?

Hi. I'm almost certain this has been asked elsewhere but I can't seem to find an answer. I'd like to review all of the sessions I wasn't able to attend live. How long will slides and recordings remain accessible via Whova? Or should I be getting them somewhere else...?

Thanks again for a wonderful conference!
You can access them via Whova untill we have bkth recordings and slides added to our website. Registered delegates have exclusively access for 6 months. After 6 months, it is publicly available.
Thanks, @Marita Mantle-Kloosterboer !

Calvin said:

Hello, I just realized that the Lets Build sessions are not recorded. I think I have missed all of these and this is something I was looking forward to towards the end via recorded sessions. Can someone please advise/ share about what was discussed in each of the LetsBuild FHIR app, especially the Java track (for all days)

For Java, a Github repo was created with the exercises and example solution here: https://github.com/hapifhir/lets-build. @Patrick Werner @James Agnew Is there more you can point @Calvin to?
sure. Here are the slides: https://bit.ly/3f8zZdT
